bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 7, 1946

div1.p: Truby announces the death of Gilhus. He describes his last visit with Gilhus. He rejects Lambert's claims concerning the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 7, 1946

opener.dateline:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco 18, California
Dec. 7 /46

div1.p:
I have just had a phone message
stating that Maj Gilhus had passed
away in a heart attack. I know no
other details, but can send them on
to you later.

Last Wednesday P. M. Gilhus & his wife
called on us and Gilhus & I spent
at least an hour in my den going
over pictures of the 2ed Div. Hosp in
Cuba which he had found and
was going to send on to you- They
a are badly faded, but will interest
you in several instances. An
interior of the “Surgical ward” shows one
of those crude old buildings near the “Surgery”.
He also had one showing one of their
military funerals with a band. Another shows
the Lazear tree- If he has not forwarded
them I will see that they are sent on
to you after the funeral when I can see
AC
T
Mrs. Gilhus-
Yesterday a copy of your letter to Kean came and
gave me a little insight on your
doings in Washington. Apparently Gen.
Kean is still going strong if he can
still fuss over things Lambert says-
I am satisfied that Lambert is deliberately
falsifying things to gain his own
ends- He realizes that most all of the
old timers have passed away and that
if he keeps up his story there will be
no one to contradict him- He was quite
honest with me at first, but he changed
when he read my book and made quite
a fuss because of what I said & Ames-
After that he took things from my story
and distorted them deliberately, I am sure-

I think you should write Dr.Brumby and
gently tell him that Lambert is a bit
mixed up in some of his statements

Admiral Stitt may have some very
interesting letters or records of Carter's-
They might bring you most valuable info.
Possibly some of Walter Reed's letters-

Have to hurry to get this in the mail box
for it is due to go in a few minutes

Too bad about Gilhus- He was a nice
chap. Born in Norway-
